Class Animal

  • java.lang.Object
    • Entity
      • Animal
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Carnivore, Herbivore

    public abstract class Animal
extends Entity
    Represents an animal, which can be a carnivore or herbivore.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class Entity

        home

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Animal(int ID, int X, int Y, int maxAge, int cooldown, int maxEnergy, int birthAge, int birthEnergy, Earth home)
      Constructor for animal.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void decreaseEnergy(int amount)
      Decreases energy of animal by specified amount.
      abstract void eatFood()
      Animal eats food in its immediate radius (one space away from its initial location).
      int getBirthAge()
      Gets the minimum age at which the animal can give birth.
      int getBirthEnergy()
      Gets the minimum amount of energy the animal needs to give birth.
      int getCooldown()
      Gets the cooldown of the animal (which determines the number of cycles between moves).
      int getEnergy()
      Gets the current energy level of animal.
      int getEnergyCost()
      Gets the amount of energy lost for the animal per cycle.

      Gets the energy level at which the animal does not need to eat.
      int getMinEnergy()
      Gets the minimum energy level the animals needs to survive.
      abstract void giveBirth()
      Animal gives birth to a new animal of the same species.
      void increaseEnergy(int amount)
      Increases energy of animal by specified amount.
      void move()
      Moves animal to an empty spot in its immediate surrounding area.
      abstract void moveTowardsFood()
      Moves animals to an empty spot in its immediate radius that has food close by (if there is one) NOTE: Animal will not have eaten after this method is executed, but it will be closer to its food.
      void setCooldown(int cooldown)
      Sets the cooldown of the animal (which determines the number of cycles between moves).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animal

        public Animal(int ID,
              int X,
              int Y,
              int maxAge,
              int cooldown,
              int maxEnergy,
              int birthAge,
              int birthEnergy,
              Earth home)
        Constructor for animal.
        Parameters:
        ID - Animal's ID.
        X - X coordinate of animal's location.
        Y - Y coordinate of animal's location.
        maxAge - Maximum age of animal.
        cooldown - Cooldown of animal (determines number of cycles between moves).
        maxEnergy - Animal will not eat when this number is reached BUT animal's energy can exceed this number.
        birthAge - Age at which animal can give birth
        birthEnergy - Minimum energy at which animal can give birth
        home - Earth on which the animal resides.

    • Method Detail

      • giveBirth

        public abstract void giveBirth()
        Animal gives birth to a new animal of the same species. The new animal will be in the immediate surrounding area of the animal that gave birth.

      • eatFood

        public abstract void eatFood()
        Animal eats food in its immediate radius (one space away from its initial location). Once the animal eats, it has moved on the grid to the food's location and the food is no longer on the grid.

      • moveTowardsFood

        public abstract void moveTowardsFood()
        Moves animals to an empty spot in its immediate radius that has food close by (if there is one) NOTE: Animal will not have eaten after this method is executed, but it will be closer to its food.

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves animal to an empty spot in its immediate surrounding area.

      • decreaseEnergy

        public void decreaseEnergy(int amount)
        Decreases energy of animal by specified amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount by which energy should be decreased.

      • increaseEnergy

        public void increaseEnergy(int amount)
        Increases energy of animal by specified amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - Amount by which energy should be increased.

      • getEnergy

        public int getEnergy()
        Gets the current energy level of animal.
        Returns:
        Current energy level of animal.

      • getEnergyCost

        public int getEnergyCost()
        Gets the amount of energy lost for the animal per cycle.
        Returns:
        The amount of energy lost for the animal per cycle.

      • getMaxEnergy

        public int getMaxEnergy()
        Gets the energy level at which the animal does not need to eat.
        Returns:
        The energy level at which the animal does not need to eat.

      • getMinEnergy

        public int getMinEnergy()
        Gets the minimum energy level the animals needs to survive.
        Returns:
        The minimum energy level the animals needs to survive.

      • getBirthAge

        public int getBirthAge()
        Gets the minimum age at which the animal can give birth.
        Returns:
        The minimum age at which the animal can give birth.

      • getBirthEnergy

        public int getBirthEnergy()
        Gets the minimum amount of energy the animal needs to give birth.
        Returns:
        The minimum amount of energy the animal needs to give birth.

      • getCooldown

        public int getCooldown()
        Gets the cooldown of the animal (which determines the number of cycles between moves).
        Returns:
        The cooldown of the animal

      • setCooldown

        public void setCooldown(int cooldown)
        Sets the cooldown of the animal (which determines the number of cycles between moves).
        Parameters:
        cooldown - The number to which the cooldown of the animal should be set to.
